description: Describes the specified EBS volumes or all of your EBS volumes. If you are describing a long list of volumes, we recommend that you paginate the output to make the list more manageable. For more information, see Pagination. For more information about EBS volumes, see Amazon EBS volumes in the Amazon EBS User Guide.

parameters.name: VolumeIds
parameters.description: The volume IDs. If not specified, then all volumes are included in the response. (string) ---

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: The filters. attachment.attach-time - The time stamp when the attachment initiated. attachment.delete-on-termination - Whether the volume is deleted on instance termination. attachment.device - The device name specified in the block device mapping (for example, /dev/sda1). attachment.instance-id - The ID of the instance the volume is attached to. attachment.status - The attachment state ( attaching | attached | detaching). availability-zone - The Availability Zone in which the volume was created. create-time - The time stamp when the volume was created. encrypted - Indicates whether the volume is encrypted ( true | false) fast-restored - Indicates whether the volume was created from a snapshot that is enabled for fast snapshot restore ( true | false). multi-attach-enabled - Indicates whether the volume is enabled for Multi-Attach ( true | false) operator.managed - A Boolean that indicates whether this is a managed volume. operator.principal - The principal that manages the volume. Only valid for managed volumes, where managed is true. size - The size of the volume, in GiB. snapshot-id - The snapshot from which the volume was created. status - The state of the volume ( creating | available | in-use | deleting | deleted | error). tag:<key> - The key/value combination of a tag assigned to the resource. Use the tag key in the filter name and the tag value as the filter value. For example, to find all resources that have a tag with the key Owner and the value TeamA, specify tag:Owner for the filter name and TeamA for the filter value. tag-key - The key of a tag assigned to the resource. Use this filter to find all resources assigned a tag with a specific key, regardless of the tag value. volume-id - The volume ID. volume-type - The Amazon EBS volume type ( gp2 | gp3 | io1 | io2 | st1 | sc1``| ``standard) (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs. If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters. For more information, see List and filter using the CLI and API in the Amazon EC2 User Guide. Name (string) --- The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. Values (list) --- The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values. (string) ---

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to include in another request to get the next page of items. This value is null when there are no more items to return.

nested_items.name: Volumes
nested_items.description: Information about the volumes.

nested_items.name: OutpostArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost.

nested_items.name: Iops
nested_items.description: The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS). For gp3, io1, and io2 volumes, this represents the number of IOPS that are provisioned for the volume. For gp2 volumes, this represents the baseline performance of the volume and the rate at which the volume accumulates I/O credits for bursting.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: Any tags assigned to the volume.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: VolumeType
nested_items.description: The volume type.

nested_items.name: FastRestored
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the volume was created using fast snapshot restore.

nested_items.name: MultiAttachEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether Amazon EBS Multi-Attach is enabled.

nested_items.name: Throughput
nested_items.description: The throughput that the volume supports, in MiB/s.

nested_items.name: SseType
nested_items.description: Reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: Managed
nested_items.description: If true, the resource is managed by a service provider.

nested_items.name: Principal
nested_items.description: If managed is true, then the principal is returned. The principal is the service provider that manages the resource.

nested_items.name: VolumeId
nested_items.description: The ID of the volume.

nested_items.name: Size
nested_items.description: The size of the volume, in GiBs.

nested_items.name: SnapshotId
nested_items.description: The snapshot from which the volume was created, if applicable.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone for the volume.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The volume state.

nested_items.name: CreateTime
nested_items.description: The time stamp when volume creation was initiated.

nested_items.name: Attachments
nested_items.description: Information about the volume attachments.

nested_items.name: DeleteOnTermination
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the EBS volume is deleted on instance termination.

nested_items.name: AssociatedResource
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Amazon ECS or Fargate task to which the volume is attached.

nested_items.name: InstanceOwningService
nested_items.description: The service principal of Amazon Web Services service that owns the underlying instance to which the volume is attached.

nested_items.name: VolumeId
nested_items.description: The ID of the volume.

nested_items.name: InstanceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the instance.

nested_items.name: Device
nested_items.description: The device name.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The attachment state of the volume.

nested_items.name: AttachTime
nested_items.description: The time stamp when the attachment initiated.

nested_items.name: Encrypted
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the volume is encrypted.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key that was used to protect the volume encryption key for the volume.
